astra.lang

Class EIS

  • java.lang.Object
    • astra.core.Module
      • astra.lang.EIS

  • public class EIS
extends astra.core.Module
    This API implements support for deploying and managing EIS environments.

    While ASTRA provides language level support for EIS events, formulae, and actions; this is only part of the picture. Support is also required for deploying, configuring and managing EIS environments. This API provides that additional support.

    To write and agent that can use an EIS environment, the following minimum number of steps is necessary:

    1. Launch the environment
    2. Join the environment
    3. Link to an entity in the environment
    4. Start the environment

    This can be implemented using the following code:

    module EISAPI eis; rule +!main(list args) {
        eis.launch("tower", "towerenv.jar");
        eis.join("tower");
        eis.link("gripper");
        eis.startEnv();
    }

    Author:
    Rem Collier

        public boolean join()
        Action that registers an agent with an existing EIS environment (if it exists) and sets it as the default environment. The action fails if the environment does not exist.
        Parameters:
        id - the environment id
        Returns:

      • link

        public boolean link()
        Action that links an agent to an entity in the default environment with the same name as the agent. The action fails if the agent is not registered with the default environment.
        Returns:

      • link

        public boolean link(java.lang.String entity)
        Action that links an agent to an entity in the environment with identifier, id, to the entity with the given name. The action fails if the agent is not registered with the environment.
        Parameters:
        id - the environment id
        entity - the entity name
        Returns:

      • startEnv

        public boolean startEnv()
        Action that starts the default environment if it is in a paused state. The action fails if the agent is not registered with the environment.
        Returns:
